description: The Alberta government is shutting down the Canadian Energy Centre — the controversial energy "war room"  — and shuffling its duties into another department.
title: Alberta government dissolves controversial energy 'war room'

description: Jin, the oldest member of K-pop phenomenon BTS, was discharged from South Korea's army on Wednesday after 18 months of duty. He was the first member of the group to wrap up the mandatory national service that put their music careers on hold.
title: BTS star Jin celebrates in uniform after completing mandatory military service

description: Police say the body found inside a vehicle that was submerged in a pond in the Molson, Man., area is believed to be that of Brittany Dawn Storey, a Winnipeg woman reported missing last week.
title: Body believed to be missing Winnipeg woman found in pond in eastern Manitoba, police say
After gun convictions, more legal hurdles still await Hunter Biden

description: After Apple announced a suite of new AI tools for its devices on Monday, including integrating OpenAI's ChatGPT, Elon Musk threatened to ban Apple devices at his companies due to what he said were 'unacceptable' risks to security and privacy. The truth is more nuanced.
title: Elon Musk claims Apple's new AI tools are a privacy risk. How much of a concern are they?

description: Every team in the six-team league got better at Monday's draft, which saw 42 players selected from seven different countries. The majority of those players came from college, but teams also stocked up on veteran talent from Europe.
title: How every PWHL team looks after the 2024 draft

description: Canada's banking sector is facing further consolidation as National Bank of Canada has reached an all-share deal to acquire Canadian Western Bank that values the lender at about $5 billion.
title: National Bank reaches deal to buy Canadian Western Bank at $5B valuation

description: Barry Sawchuk made headlines earlier this year when he said a giant piece of space debris had slammed into his field. This week, SpaceX came to his farm near Ituna, northeast of Regina, to collect the space junk.
title: SpaceX retrieves space junk from Sask. farmer

description: The former financial manager of the Elizabeth Fry Society in Prince George, B.C., was led out of the courtroom in handcuffs Tuesday, after she was sentenced to a two-and-a-half-year jail term for stealing almost a quarter-million dollars that was supposed to help vulnerable women and girls.
title: Jail time for financial manager who stole $240k earmarked to support vulnerable women and girls

description: Elephants appear to know their own names, according to a new study. Not the very nicknames we humans sometimes give them, but their own, unique elephant names, which they use to call to each other.
title: Elephants may have names for each other that humans don't know, study finds

description: Evan Dunfee won’t get a chance to upgrade the bronze medal he won at the Olympics in 2021. Dunfee came in third in the 50km race walk in Tokyo. But the event, which had been in the Olympics since 1932, was dropped by the International Olympic Committee.
title: His Olympic event was cut, but he's finding a new way to compete in Paris

description: The Manitoba government has cleared one more hurdle in the push to search a Winnipeg-area landfill for the remains of two victims of an admitted serial killer.
title: Plan to search Manitoba landfill for women's remains moves ahead as province approves environmental licence change

description: The Manitoba government has cleared one more hurdle in the push to search a Winnipeg-area landfill for the remains of two victims of an admitted serial killer.
title: Plan to search Manitoba landfill for women's remains moves ahead as province approves environmental licence change

description: Canadians, get ready for another summer of above-average temperatures. But when it comes to rain, Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) said that the forecast is a little bit murkier.
title: Expect above-average temperatures during the follow-up to Canada's hottest summer on record

description: Natalie Spooner has been named the most valuable player of the inaugural Professional Women's Hockey League season.
title: PWHL Toronto forward Natalie Spooner named league's inaugural MVP

description: B.C. Premier David Eby was “confused” about the facts when he criticized the federal government this week for giving Quebec $750 million to manage asylum seekers, Immigration Minister Marc Miller said Tuesday.
title: Marc Miller defends $750M in immigration funding for Quebec, says B.C. premier was 'confused'

description: Chiquita Brands International must pay $38.3 million US in damages to the families of eight Colombian men killed by a paramilitary group in that country, a Florida jury said on Monday.
title: Banana company Chiquita ordered to pay families of men killed by Colombian paramilitary

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said Tuesday his party will oppose the government's proposed capital gains inclusion rate increase — a tax hike that is projected to pull in some $19 billion in new revenue.
title: Poilievre says Tories will vote against capital gains tax hike, calls it a 'job killer'

description: Environment Minister Steven Guilbeault broke the law when he waited eight months to recommend an emergency order protecting British Columbia’s endangered spotted owls, a federal court judge has ruled.
title: Environment minister broke law over delay in recommending emergency order for spotted owl, judge rules

description: The boat was carrying about 260 Somalis and Ethiopians from the northern coast of Somalia on the 320-kilometre journey across the Gulf of Aden when it sank Monday off of Yemen's southern coast, the International Organization for Migration said in a statement.
title: Dozens killed, 140 missing after migrant boat from Somalia sinks off Yemen coast

description: A plastics plant in southwestern Ontario that was ordered by the province and federal government to reduce emissions of the cancer-causing chemical benzene now says it will permanently shut down.
title: Ontario plastics plant facing government orders to reduce toxic emissions will shut down permanently

description: Animal rights activists have defaced the first official portrait of King Charles with a cut-out face of a cartoon character at a gallery in London.
title: King Charles portrait vandalized with Wallace and Gromit cartoon

description: An Ontario judge has found Tenzin Norbu was suffering from schizophrenia, which made him incapable of "appreciating his act was wrong" when he attacked 28-year-old Nyima Dolma.
title: Toronto man not criminally responsible for setting woman on fire on bus

description: Céline Dion says she wishes she had stopped earlier to figure out why her body was failing her. Speaking to Hoda Kotb in a preview that aired Tuesday morning, the Canadian singer shared information about stiff-person syndrome, the disease she has been struggling with for nearly two decades.
title: Céline Dion reveals fears, hope around health issues in NBC interview

description: A tentative agreement has been reached for over 9,000 workers at Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA), the unions say, averting potential job action later this week.
title: Tentative deal reached for Canada's border workers, unions say

description: Hunter Biden, son of U.S. President Joe Biden, was convicted Tuesday of lying about his drug use to illegally buy a gun.
title: Hunter Biden found guilty of lying about drug use to illegally buy gun

description: Mathieu Grondin has been named Ottawa's new nightlife commissioner, and is already promising to reverse the city's reputation as a sleepy burg that rolls up the sidewalks at night.
title: 'The city fun is about to remember': Meet the Montrealer hired to make Ottawa cooler

description: The conservative justice is also heard seeming to agree with a woman who says the United States should return "to a place of godliness."
title: U.S. Supreme Court Justice Alito questions if left and right can compromise in secret recording

description: CBC/Radio-Canada has entered a multi-year partnership with the Northern Super League, along with TSN/RDS. CBC Sports will deliver women's professional soccer matches across its national network and digital platforms during the inaugural season next April.
title: CBC/Radio-Canada strikes multi-year deal to broadcast, stream Northern Super League games

description: Ismail Alyan's home was among those destroyed by an intense Israeli operation in Nuseirat, in central Gaza, that saw the rescue of four hostages Hamas had held since October. Palestinian officials said the raid had killed more than 200 people and injured almost 700.
title: 'It's a miracle we survived,' says father of 5 whose home was destroyed in Israeli hostage rescue raid

description: Dalhousie University has pulled all medical students and post-graduate trainees from any cardiac training at the Saint John Regional Hospital and New Brunswick Heart Centre after some learners complained about alleged harassment and the learning environment, CBC News has learned.
title: Dalhousie University halts Saint John cardiac training after students allege harassment

description: Artists Wayne Maloney and Michelle Penney Rowe say when the Doctor’s House Inn and Spa closed, their artwork disappeared and they haven't been able to reach the owner. They’re speaking out in hopes their artwork will be found.
title: Their artwork once hung on the walls of an upscale inn. The artists want it back
RCMP official calls for debate on hate speech law after probe of imam ends without charges

description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford's order to the LCBO to bring back paper bags caught the Crown corporation's management off guard, emails obtained by Radio-Canada reveal.
title: Doug Ford's paper-bag order caught LCBO execs by surprise

description: Period myths online abound, and many have been around for ages. But platforms like TikTok and Instagram cause these myths to spread faster and reach a wider audience. To combat that, a movement of people is trying to change how we talk — and learn — about our periods.
title: Here are some of the people trying to fix period education across North America

description: The office of Ontario’s ombudsman says it will 'raise questions' with the Ministry of the Solicitor General after a CBC investigation showed the use of segregation has grown in recent years and is happening at a higher rate in Hamilton than any other provincial jail.
title: Ontario Ombudsman to 'raise questions' with province about segregation in jails

description: Last week, publicly run youth jails in Sudbury, Simcoe and Brampton were either at or over capacity, according to CBC News sources. Ontario closed roughly half of its youth detention centres three years ago, and now there are concerns overcapacity issues are having a negative impact on staff and youth.
title: Ontario youth detention centres at overcapacity, creating concerns as another is set to close

description: A ransomware attack disrupted several London hospitals' ability to match patients to their correct blood type, leading to an urgent call for O positive and negative donors. The incident underlines the severity of the ransomware epidemic.
title: Ransomware attack on England's health system highlights life-threatening impact of cybercrime

description: Just as the Stanley Cup Finals kicked off last week, the NHL announced its next big play: a reality series about its hockey stars, from the producers of Netflix's ultra-popular Drive to Survive. But can a reality program do for hockey what Drive to Survive did for Formula One racing — or was that lightning in a bottle?
title: The NHL is the latest sports league using reality TV to draw in new fans. Will it work?

description: U.S government officials have discussed the possibility of trade sanctions against Canada as a result of Quebec's controversial Bill 96 language law, CBC News has learned. The U.S. government is also being told that Bill 96 could affect the availability of products throughout Canada.
title: U.S. officials discussed hitting Canada with trade sanctions over Quebec's language law
